thread.title: Math Scores Drop for New York City Fourth-Graders

author: Leslie Brody
title: Math Scores Drop for New York City Fourth-Graders
text:
New York City’s new schools chancellor pledged to boost training for elementary math teachers on Tuesday, after a national test found a drop in average math scores for the city’s fourth-graders.
The National Assessment of Educational Progress, also known as the “Nation’s Report Card,” found the district’s average score for fourth-graders in math fell to 229 last year, down from 236 in 2013, out of a possible 500 points.
“We...
